abstract.para: This file provides documentation for file 94boct06.dat, a comma delimited file that contains bromide (Br) concentrations over time at two sites on the Kuparuk river July 5, 1994.

intellectualRights.para: Acceptance and utilization of LTER data requires that:

listitem.para: The Principal Investigator be sent a notice stating reasons for acquiring any data and a description of the publication intentions.
The Principal Investigator of the data set be sent a copy of the report or manuscript prior to submission and be adequately cited in any resultant publications
A copy of any resultant publications should be sent to:Principal Investigator Ecosystems Center Marine Biological Laboratory Woods Hole, MA 02543

geographicCoverage.geographicDescription: The solute injection site was at -0.286km on the river's marking system. Samples were collected at 0.848km (A) and 1.618km (B) downstream of the injection site or 562 and 1332 meters based on the river's marking system. Solute injection lasted for four hours.

description.para:
For Archival Use:
DATA RECEIVED: June 1997 DATA FILE ENTERED BY: Karie Slavik DATA FILE VALIDATION: NAME: DATA:

para.literalLayout: The channel locations were instrumented with Orion bromide selective electrodes and a reference electrode to monitor instream bromide concentrations and guide the collection of physical samples. Physical samples were collected at irregular time intervals weighted to cover the rising and falling limbs more intensively than other time periods. Upon return, the physical samples were analyzed by HPLC on a Dionex AS4A Anion column with a detection limit of 10 ug/L. Injection Start: 0 minutes Injection End: 240 minutes

Notes: (11) VARIABLE DESCRIPTIONS: Precis. Coded? Reference Citations: Kilpatrick,F.A. and Cobb,E.D. 1985. Measurement of discharge using tracers. Techniques of Water-Resource Investigations of the United States Geological Survey. Stream Solute Workshop 1990. Concepts and methods for assessing solute dynamics in stream ecosystems. J. N. Amer. Benthol. Soc., 9(2):95-119.
